paragraphs.text: The big orange shed that holds the key to Britain's economic recovery.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: On an industrial estate on the northernmost outskirts of the capital hulks a big orange shed that will form part of the answer as to whether Britain really can fix its broken economic model
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A big claim, I know
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: practically everyone who visits Building Bloqs comes away convinced of its importance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Perhaps it's the promise it holds
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: bringing jobs to a jobless local economy, re-inserting manufacturing into a deindustrialised husk of a place
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Maybe it's the warmth of the directors, all in their 30s: Al Parra, ever ready with schooners of tea; Arnaud Nichols, always enthusing about some engineering project; and Alex Motta, whose cheap gourmet canteen feeds mezze to the local forklift drivers
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: These guys aren't even in it for the money
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Like the Co-op grocers or the Big Issue, Building Bloqs is a social enterprise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it has to pay its way in the world, but seeks to reinvest the profits and caps how much anyone can take out
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No wonder local councillors vow to do all they can to help Al, Arnaud and Alex, or that George Osborne invites them to Downing Street
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Or that they not only win an award for innovation, but one of the judges now does their books for free
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet despite all the goodwill and the unanimous political agreement that this is the kind of start-up Britain needs, it's touch and go if Building Bloqs will survive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just why that should be is a compelling, depressing and instructive tale about how little politicians on all sides have learned in the wake of the crash
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To grasp the importance of Building Bloqs, just look at the even bigger neighbouring sheds in whose shadow it sits
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Yes, that's the giant Tesco
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: where on Black Friday last November punters fought for marked-down coffee machines
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And it's right next to the Ikea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: whose opening sparked a near-riot
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Both those retailing behemoths are on Glover Drive, named after Glover and Main
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which manufactured millions of the gas stoves used in British kitchens after the war
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This entire area, where Tottenham tips into Edmonton, used to be a manufacturing powerhouse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Now it's all gone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what's replaced the factories is... sweet FA
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I grew up here, and have seen this area slide within three decades from a place of working-class prosperity to one of the most deprived parts of the country
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Nowadays they call it Shanktown: a place of knife murders and gang violence
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Against that backdrop of dead-end criminality and plastic consumerism, Building Bloqs stands out
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This isn't some Pathe newsreel factory
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The people inside aren't on an assembly line churning out the same goods
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead, they're freelancers who pay about? 20 a day to hire a bench and get access to all the tools and knowhow of Al and Arnaud - and each other
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's called a makerspace, a non-profit collaborative workplace of a kind spreading across America, yet still quite new in Britain
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the 14 months since opening, Building Bloqs has transformed lives
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Set designer Hugo, who couldn't afford his own workspace and used to work either in a garden or in the theatre, now has a cheap space to build, experiment and store his designs
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Joe, who for years had to rely on more established mates to pass him carpentry jobs, now has an HQ, a client base and an enterprise
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Of the 70 members, around 40% are running a self-sustaining business out of this building
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Around 30 livelihoods and households have been changed by it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: two enterprises have been spun out
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a hollowed-out local economy has received a substantial boost
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is the march of the makers promised by Osborne
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is the rebalancing all the politicians prayed for
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But this is also the place that shows how all that talk was just guff
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is an open question whether Building Bloqs lives or dies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Despite pulling 60-hour weeks, the directors draw no salary from it
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They eat and do their laundry at the shed, and work on the side for cash
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Last weekend, Arnaud totted up his entire life savings
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: he has? 200 to his name
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Although the company has been breaking even for the past few months, the roof leaks, half the electricity runs off extension leads, and the unheated open space is Arctic
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Why are they in such a state?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For exactly the same reason everyone likes them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because they're new and different
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So different
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: although Al has tried everywhere for lending from nationalised Lloyds to ethical Triodos
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: he couldn't even raise a? 10,000 overdraft
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Had he wanted financing to open a franchise of McDonald's he would have had fewer hurdles to jump
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Edmonton would have a few more zero-hours jobs, and be a few thousand quarter pounders further into an obesity epidemic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But a new social enterprise with no financial track record proved too much for the bank managers to get their heads around
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Politically, the response has been just as woeful
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The rightwing solution to Building Bloqs' problems was on offer at that Downing Street social hosted by Osborne
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: where"sharing economy" start-ups rubbed shoulders with venture capitalists
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when Arnaud buttonholed an investor
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: he was told that Building Bloqs was a lovely idea,"but I am never going to make five times my money back off you guys"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Labour-run Enfield council has been good on other things
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: here the local politicians have just pointed to austerity as an excuse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So Labour sticks to its old solution of public funds, and the Tories offer more market - and, meanwhile, Building Bloqs and other hopes of rebuilding a broken economy fade away
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From the fall of Northern Rock in 2007 to September 2014, Britain lost a net total of 352,000 manufacturing jobs
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: London and the south-east shed 87,000 manufacturing posts
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: even while it gained 15,000 more financiers
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Those figures tell you plenty about the new old economy that Britain is building
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After a pleasantly full and frank exchange over the weekend, the Enfield councillor in charge of regeneration has offered to think again about how he might help Building Bloqs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Here are some ideas for him - and for every area that has been stripped of a local economy
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: set up a register of local professionals who might offer their accountancy, legal and other expertise pro bono to companies such as Building Bloqs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ask local ventures to list the services and materials they need
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: hook up makerspaces to the local further education colleges
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: to provide work experience and publicity
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: challenge the big banks to lend more money to genuinely local businesses; and finally, ask Ikea to use its empty lobbies
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to advertise places like Building Bloqs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I wish Al, Arnaud and Alex every success
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: rebuilding Britain's economy must not rest on three men working their arses off and not knowing if they'll be here this time next year
paragraphs.label: assumption
